description: Erection of a single-storey side/rear extension; erection of a mansard roof extension; installation of terrace at roof level to front of mansard
decision_conditions: <p>Due to its inappropriate roof design and height along the shared boundary with no. 76 Winston Road, the proposed ground-floor extension would have a significant and detrimental impact on the amenity enjoyed by residents of this neighbouring property, particularly in regard to loss of outlook, increased sense of enclosure, and loss of daylight/sunlight. In addition, the creation of a front roof terrace would be likely to impact residents of neighbouring properties of nos. 72 and 76 in regard to increased noise and disturbance. The proposed development is therefore considered unacceptable and fails to comply with policies D3 (<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" id="docs-internal-guid-c9359472-7fff-2f44-9a7d-8c61ff77a61c">Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach) and D4 (Delivering good design) of the London Plan (2021) and policies LP1 (</span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" id="docs-internal-guid-9dd48193-7fff-cf7c-a5a9-2fc0fc42bd46">Design Quality and Local Character) and LP2 (</span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" id="docs-internal-guid-142ad55c-7fff-003b-ad42-e8d91046feca">Development and Amenity) of the Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020).</span><br></p>

<p>Due to the inappropriate height and roof design of the ground-floor infill extension, and an unacceptable design of the mansard extension with front roof terrace, the proposed development would be an unacceptable form of development that would detract from the character of the immediate area. The development would introduce an incongruous form of development that would fail to comply with the stipulations outlined in the council's Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (2009). The proposal is therefore considered unacceptable and fails to comply with Policies D3 (<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" id="docs-internal-guid-c9359472-7fff-2f44-9a7d-8c61ff77a61c">Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach) and D4 (Delivering good design) of the London Plan (2021) and Policies LP1 (</span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" id="docs-internal-guid-9dd48193-7fff-cf7c-a5a9-2fc0fc42bd46">Design Quality and Local Character) </span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline;" id="docs-internal-guid-142ad55c-7fff-003b-ad42-e8d91046feca">&nbsp;of the Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020).</span><br></p>
